segment.source: This planning topic describes the app information that you should document when you create a list of apps for AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This planning topic describes the app information that you should document when you create a list of apps for AppLocker policies.

segment.source: This planning topic describes the app information that you should document when you create a list of apps for AppLocker policies.
segment.target: This planning topic describes the app information that you should document when you create a list of apps for AppLocker policies.

segment.source: Record the name of the app, whether it is signed as indicated by the publisher's name, and whether it is a mission critical, business productivity, optional, or personal app.
segment.target: Record the name of the app, whether it is signed as indicated by the publisher's name, and whether it is a mission critical, business productivity, optional, or personal app.

segment.source: Later, as you manage your rules, AppLocker displays this information in the format shown in the following example: MICROSOFT OFFICE INFOPATH signed by O=MICROSOFT CORPORATION, L=REDMOND, S=WASHINGTON, C=US.
segment.target: Later, as you manage your rules, AppLocker displays this information in the format shown in the following example: MICROSOFT OFFICE INFOPATH signed by O=MICROSOFT CORPORATION, L=REDMOND, S=WASHINGTON, C=US.

segment.source: Record the installation path of the apps.
segment.target: Record the installation path of the apps.

segment.source: For example, Microsoft Office 2016 installs files to %programfiles%Microsoft OfficeOffice16, which is C:Program FilesMicrosoft OfficeOffice16 on most devices.
segment.target: For example, Microsoft Office 2016 installs files to %programfiles%Microsoft OfficeOffice16, which is C:Program FilesMicrosoft OfficeOffice16 on most devices.

segment.source: The following table provides an example of how to list applications for each business group at the early stage of designing your application control policies.
segment.target: The following table provides an example of how to list applications for each business group at the early stage of designing your application control policies.

segment.source: Eventually, as more planning information is added to the list, the information can be used to build AppLocker rules.
segment.target: Eventually, as more planning information is added to the list, the information can be used to build AppLocker rules.

segment.source: Note: AppLocker only supports publisher rules for Universal Windows apps.
segment.target: Note: AppLocker only supports publisher rules for Universal Windows apps.

segment.source: Therefore, collecting the installation path information for Universal Windows apps is not necessary.
segment.target: Therefore, collecting the installation path information for Universal Windows apps is not necessary.

segment.source: As you create your list of apps, you need to consider how to manage the events that are generated by user access, or you need to deny running those apps to make your users as productive as possible.
segment.target: As you create your list of apps, you need to consider how to manage the events that are generated by user access, or you need to deny running those apps to make your users as productive as possible.

segment.source: The following list is an example of what to consider and what to record:
segment.target: The following list is an example of what to consider and what to record:

segment.source: Will event forwarding be implemented for AppLocker events?
segment.target: Will event forwarding be implemented for AppLocker events?

segment.source: What is the location of the AppLocker event collection?
segment.target: What is the location of the AppLocker event collection?

segment.source: Should an event archival policy be implemented?
segment.target: Should an event archival policy be implemented?

segment.source: Will the events be analyzed and how often?
segment.target: Will the events be analyzed and how often?

segment.source: Should a security policy be in place for event collection?
segment.target: Should a security policy be in place for event collection?

segment.source: As you create your list of apps, you need to consider how to manage and maintain the policies that you will eventually create.
segment.target: As you create your list of apps, you need to consider how to manage and maintain the policies that you will eventually create.

segment.source: The following list is an example of what to consider and what to record:
segment.target: The following list is an example of what to consider and what to record:

segment.source: How will rules be updated for emergency app access and permanent access?
segment.target: How will rules be updated for emergency app access and permanent access?

segment.source: How many older versions of the same app will be maintained?
segment.target: How many older versions of the same app will be maintained?

segment.source: How will new apps be introduced?
segment.target: How will new apps be introduced?

segment.source: After you have created the list of applications, the next step is to identify the rule collections, which will become the application control policies.
segment.target: After you have created the list of applications, the next step is to identify the rule collections, which will become the application control policies.

segment.source: This information can be added to the table under the following columns:
segment.target: This information can be added to the table under the following columns:

segment.source: Use default rule or define new rule condition
segment.target: Use default rule or define new rule condition

segment.source: To identify the rule collections, see the following topics:
segment.target: To identify the rule collections, see the following topics:

segment.source: Select the types of rules to create
segment.target: Select the types of rules to create

segment.source: Determine Group Policy structure and rule enforcement
segment.target: Determine Group Policy structure and rule enforcement
